column13: In FY23, Macquarie joined the Qantas SAF Coalition as one of the founding members of Australia's first coalition program to help decarbonise aviation using sustainable fuel. As the industry finalises the SAF certification and claim process, Macquarie will apply and report on the attributable emissions reductions.
column20: Qantas SAF Coalition, aviation, sustainable fuel

column13: In 2022, Macquarie's GIG launched a global battery storage business, Eku Energy, to increase the flexibility of energy systems and enable more renewable energy capacity to connect to the grid. In October 2022, GIG acquired BayWare's specialist biogas platform via a MAM-managed fund. Now operating as VORN Bioenergy, the business develops, constructs, and operates biogas projects that provide biomethane and power to local energy companies, industrials and energy traders.
column20: Global battery storage, Eku Energy, renewable energy

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: In September 2022, Macquarie's GIG launched Fleete, a new EV infrastructure business for operators of electric commercial vehicles aimed at accelerating the EV transition. Before this, GIG launched a joint venture, HyCC, which uses water electrolysis to produce green hydrogen from renewable power on an industrial scale.
column20: Fleete, EV infrastructure business, EV transition

column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Throughout FY2023, five organisations were awarded $A10 million each as part of the Macquarie 50th Anniversary Award in 2019 and continued to progress against each project milestone. An example is Monash University's World Mosquito Program, which scaled mosquito releases in Colombia and expanded operations into Laos and El Salvador. The Wolbachia-carrying mosquitos will protect millions from deadly mosquito-borne diseases, including dengue fever, Zika virus and yellow fever.
column20: World Mosquito Program, Macquarie 50th Anniversary Award, Zika virus

column13: Macquarie is committed to managing all electronic waste through sustainably certified suppliers to ensure it is managed responsibly. The first phase of this scope of work involves disposing of laptops, desktops, and communications room e-waste. It is managed through sustainably-certified suppliers globally.
column20: Electronic waste, sustainably certified supplier, laptop

column7: Macquarie could not disclose this information due to information unavailability.
Macquarie's scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 411 tCO2e.
Macquarie's scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 14,568 tCO2e.
Macquarie's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 216,018 tCO2e.
Macquarie's scope 3 emissions intensity in 2023 was 10.72 tCO2e per capita.

column13: Macquarie Capital is investing in renewable natural gas (RNG) projects, including Adapt Biogas in the UK and establishing the Aerogy platform in the US. Aerogy and Adapt Biogas develop, operate, and invest in innovative RNG projects across the US and Europe, respectively. RNG diverts methane from cow manure and other sources, converting it into energy.
column20: Adapt Biogas, renewable natural gas, Aerogy platform
